message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and colonoscopy findings suggest inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Sulfasalazine is commonly used to treat IBD, but if it is not effective, a second drug such as azathioprine or methotrexate may be added. The most common adverse effect associated with these drugs is infection due to immunosuppression. Worsening of osteoporosis is unlikely to be a side effect of these drugs, and megaloblastic anemia is more commonly associated with sulfasalazine use. Hepatotoxicity can occur with both sulfasalazine and azathioprine/methotrexate, but infection is more common.
